The COVID-19 pandemic has changed priorities and forced a reorganization of several outpatient services and inpatients management. Furthermore, the strict lockdown measures have major psychological impact on the whole population, including children and adolescents, as they are abruptly experiencing a dramatic change in life habits, increased social isolation and subjective feelings of loneliness, and changed management of deaths and comfort.
98 Moreover, diet habits are changing as well, as most subjects have gained weight during the lockdown. All these things will have an unpredictable impact on patients with gastrointestinal diseases, on health personnel involved in gastrointestinal services, and also on organizational schemes for the “post-COVID” era.
